Detailed Description

Importance sampling is a well-known strategy for Monte-Carlo based rendering algorithms to reduce variance i.e noise. Briefly, secondary rays are sampled at the surface to be rendered based on a pdf that behaves closely to the surfaces' BRDF. Basic usage:

AXF_REPRESENTATION_HANDLE h_axf_rep = axfGetPreferredRepresentation( h_axf_file );
CPUDecoder* pcl_decoder = CPUDecoder::create( h_axf_rep );
...
Sampler* pcl_sampler = Sampler::create( h_axf_rep, pcl_decoder );
...
Vec3 v3_sampled;
Vec3 v3_xi = rndVec3();
float f_pdf = pcl_sampler->sample( &v3_xi[0], &v3_dir[0], uv, &v3_sampled[0] );
...
pcl_sampler->destroy();

Definition at line 53 of file Sampler.h.

Member Function Documentation

◆ sample()

float axf::decoding::Sampler::sample ( const float *  v3Xi,
const float *  v3Dir,
const float *  v2UV,
float *  v3DirSampled 
) const
Parameters
v3XiVector of three random values \( \xi_{0,1,2} \in [0,1]\) drawn from a uniform distribution
v3DirThe normalized direction of the (viewing) ray in local tangent space for which corresponding ray will be sampled
v2UVNormalized UV coordinate \(u,v \in [0,1)\) specifying the location on the material
v3DirSampledReturns the sampled normalized direction in local tangent space
Returns
Value of the sampled pdf for the drawn direction

The actual pdf used for sampling depends on the representation.

◆ pdf()

const float *  v3DirOut,
const float *  v2UV 
) const
Parameters
v3DirInThe normalized direction of the incoming ray in local tangent space
v3DirOutThe normalized direction of the outgoing ray in local tangent space
v2UVNormalized UV coordinate \(u,v \in [0,1)\) specifying the location on the material
Returns
Value of the pdf.

Evaluate the pdf used for sampling the representation.
